roleset.name: the act of deciding, regulation, law, decide
roleset.note: RULE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus, and comparison with 'decide'. (from rule.01-v)
RULE-N NOTES: Roleset somewhat related to rule-v.01 Verbnet class dub-29.3. Framed by Katie. (from rule.01-n)
RULING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry rule.01. Corresponds to VN class 29.3. (from ruling.01-n)

example.name: rule a sentence
example.text: In August, the commission ruled that between $190 million and $195million of the plant's construction cost was unreasonable and shouldbe refunded, plus interest.
example.arg: between $190 million and $195 million of the plant's construction cost was unreasonable and should be refunded, plus interest.

example.name: rule on
example.text: [The commission]-1 is expected *trace*-1 to rule on the Braidwood 2 case by year end.

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: In a case involving Avondale Industries Inc. and its insurer, Travelers Cos., the Second U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in New York ruled in favor of the company on two issues that lawyers say are central to dozens of pollution cases around the country.
example.arg: In a case involving Avondale Industries Inc. and its insurer, Travelers Cos.
the Second U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in New York
on two issues that lawyers say are central to dozens of pollution cases around the country.

example.name: raising
example.text: The Supreme Court agreed to decide whether a federal court may dismantle [a merger]-1 that *trace-1*-2 has won regulatory approval but been ruled *trace-2* anticompetitive in a private suit.

example.name: Tricky arg 0
example.text: its ability to operate its national television network underAustralian broadcast license rules

example.name: Example with args 1 and 2
example.text: Rules of the road for our soldiers

example.name: with args 1 and 3
example.text: I don't understand the baseball rule that the third strike (swinging) must be caught by the catcher...
example.arg: that the third strike (swinging) must be caught by the catcher

example.name: Arg0 only, within LVC
example.text: A three-judge panel of the court made the ruling Saturday.

example.name: most args
example.text: The Illinois Supreme Court seems to have over looked that ?detail? in their ruling of 7-0 in favor of Emanuel.

roleset.name: show leadership
roleset.note: RULE-N NOTES: Roleset based on rule.03. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from rule.02-n)

example.name: rule over
example.text: It's time business leaders and the general public learn that mankind does not rule over this natural environment but is rather the integral, symbiotic player within nature's workings.

example.name: just plain rule
example.text: Both hope to encourage pressure for change in [East bloc countries]-1 still ruled [*]-1 by Stalinist holdouts by arranging liberal financial aid and trade benefits for Poland, Hungary and, to a lesser extent, the Soviet Union.

example.name: with explicit mention of rulership
example.text: Other analysts say [the Indian leader]-1 could retain control with a slim majority or be forced [*-1]to rule as the dominant partner in a coalition with other parties.
example.arg: as the dominant partner in a coalition with other parties.

example.name: Example with arg 1, where you might be tempted to annotate an arg 0
example.text: In the play , the Duke of Vienna despairs over the licentiousnessof his subjects and turns over the rule of the city to thepuritanical Angelo , hoping he can set things right .

example.name: Example with arg 0
example.text: hard-line leader Honecker , whose rule has been challenged bymass emigration and calls for democratic freedoms

example.name: not anymore
example.text: Paribas Chairman Michel Francois-Poncet wouldn't rule out *trace* eventually selling all of Navigation Mixte's insurance operations to Allianz.
example.arg: *trace* eventually selling all of Navigation Mixte's insurance operations to Allianz.
